item.title: This founder cracked firefighting — now he’s creating an AI gold mine
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The nozzle is just the beginning – what company founder Sunny Sethi calls "the muscle on the ground.”

item.title: ChatGPT is pulling answers from Elon Musk’s Grokipedia
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Information from the conservative-leaning, AI-generated encyclopedia developed by Elon Musk’s xAI is beginning to appear in answers from ChatGPT.

item.title: Humans& thinks coordination is the next frontier for AI, and they’re building a model to prove it
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Humans&, a new startup founded by alumni of Anthropic, Meta, OpenAI, xAI, and Google DeepMind, is building the next generation of foundation models for collaboration, not chat.

item.title: Science fiction writers, Comic-Con say goodbye to AI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.category: science fiction and fantasy writers association
item.description: Some of the major players in science fiction and pop culture are taking firmer stances against generative AI.

item.title: Apple will reportedly unveil its Gemini-powered Siri assistant in February
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: We’re about to get our first real look at the results of the recently announced AI partnership between Apple and Google.

item.title: Tech CEOs boast and bicker about AI at Davos
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: There were times at this week’s meeting of the World Economic Forum when Davos seemed transformed into a high-powered tech conference.

item.title: Former Googlers seek to captivate kids with an AI-powered learning app
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Sparkli said that education systems often fall behind in teaching modern concepts. The company wants to teach kids about topics like skills design, financial literacy, and entrepreneurship by creating an AI-powered learning "expedition."

item.title: A new test for AI labs: Are you even trying to make money?
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: It’s getting hard to tell which AI labs. are actually trying to make money. We created a rating system to help sort it out.

item.title: Legal AI giant Harvey acquires Hexus as competition heats up in legal tech
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Hexus founder and CEO Sakshi Pratap, who previously held engineering roles at Walmart, Oracle, and Google, tells TechCrunch that her San Francisco-based team has already joined Harvey, while the startup's India-based engineers will come onboard once Harvey establishes a Bangalore office.

item.title: Who’s behind AMI Labs, Yann LeCun’s ‘world model’ startup
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Yann LeCun's new venture, AMI Labs, has drawn intense attention since the AI scientist left Meta to found it.

item.title: How did Davos turn into a tech conference?
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: The World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Davos felt different this year, and not just because Meta and Salesforce took over storefronts on the main promenade. AI dominated the conversation in a way that overshadowed traditional topics like climate change and global poverty, and the CEOs weren’t holding back. There was public criticism of trade policy, warnings about AI […]

item.title: Google Photos’ latest feature lets you meme yourself
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The addition is meant to just be a fun way to explore your photos and experiment with Google's Gemini AI technology, and specifically Nano Banana.

item.title: Meta pauses teen access to AI characters ahead of new version
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Meta today said that it is pausing teens' access to its AI characters globally across all its apps. The company mentioned that it is not abandoning its efforts but wants to develop an updated version of AI characters for teens.

item.title: AI CEOs transformed Davos into a tech conference
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Anthony Ha, Kirsten Korosec, Sean O'Kane
item.description: The World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Davos felt different this year, and not just because Meta and Salesforce took over storefronts on the main promenade. AI dominated the conversation in a way that overshadowed traditional topics like climate change and global poverty, and the CEOs weren’t holding back. There was public criticism of trade policy, warnings about AI […]

item.title: OpenAI chief Sam Altman plans India visit as AI leaders converge in New Delhi: sources
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The visit comes as New Delhi prepares to host a major AI summit expected to draw top executives from Meta, Google, and Anthropic. This will be Altman's first visit to the country in nearly a year.

item.title: Only 1 week left (or until the first 500 passes are gone): The first TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 ticket discount is ending
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Register now to save up to $680 on your TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 pass and get a second ticket at 50% off. This offer ends next week on January 30, or once the first 500 tickets are claimed — whichever comes first.

item.title: Former Sequoia partner’s new startup uses AI to negotiate your calendar for you
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Blockit, an AI agent that communicates directly with other calendars, has raised $5 million in seed funding led by Sequoia.

item.title: OpenAI is coming for those sweet enterprise dollars in 2026
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: OpenAI has reportedly appointed Barret Zoph to lead its push into enterprise just a week after Zoph rejoined the company.

item.title: Voice AI engine and OpenAI partner LiveKit hits $1B valuation
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The five-year-old-startup powers OpenAI’s ChatGPT voice mode and raised a $100 million round led by Index Ventures.

item.title: Inference startup Inferact lands $150M to commercialize vLLM
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The seed round values the newly formed startup at $800 million.
